name: good luck duck
notes:
free pattern is available as a [video tutorial][1] on my blog: 

[crochet kit available][2]. 

this pocket duck pattern is beginner friendly and quick to work up. it’s also a no-sew pattern, meaning it’s worked completely in one piece. this bird can be kept as a squishy plush with a super bulky blanket or chenille velvet yarn. it can also be turned into a small “keychain” size with thinner weight yarns and a smaller hook. crochet a family of duckies of varying sizes by using different weights of yarn. play with different yarn colors to make a mallard duck, or use one solid yellow to create a rubber ducky. 
     
this miniature duckling is great as a good luck charm, birthday gift, christmas or holiday gift, as party favors, or market and craft fair products. they make adorable baby shower gifts, decor for nursery rooms, or even crib mobile attachments.  kids and adults alike will adore this cute stuffed animal amigurumi toy! 

**size**
height: 3.5” (9 cm)
 
**materials**
hobbii baby snuggle (super bulky “6”) yarn in desired colors
9mm plastic safety eyes (x2)
5mm crochet hook
stuffing
scissors

**level**
★★☆☆☆ familiar beginner/intermediate. requires familiarity with stitches used (below), changing colors, and attaching yarn.

**stitches & techniques used (us terminology)** 
fo = fasten off
ch = chain
sl st = slip stitch
sc = single crochet
inc = increase (insert 2 sc in same st)
dec = decrease (sc 2 sts together)
hdc = half double crochet
dc = double crochet
